questions.question: We went …………………………… in the morning.
questions.description: There is no preposition in the expression go swimming, go walking, go climbing etc.

questions.question: Let’s ……………………….. something.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I went …………………….. Canada to meet my brother.
I have invited all of my friends ……………………. my party.
questions.description: You are invited to a specific event.

questions.question: You .................... get some rest.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice.

questions.question: One of my cousins ……………………… a singer.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after one of.

questions.question: The teacher had scarcely left the class ………………………. the children started talking.
questions.description: Scarcely is followed by when or before.

questions.question: No sooner had I opened the door, …………………….. the cat jumped out.
questions.description: We use than after no sooner.

questions.question: I was hardly inside the house ……………………… it started raining.
questions.description: Hardly is followed by when or before.

questions.question: How about …………………….. a drink?
questions.description: Use an ing form after how about and what about.

questions.question: She accused me ...................... stealing her watch.
